intro: Atriplex grisebachii, commonly known as silverleaf saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which reflects sunlight and reduces water loss in harsh environments. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. It is adapted to saline and alkaline soils, making it a valuable plant for stabilizing degraded lands. Atriplex grisebachii plays an important role in supporting local wildlife and is often used in restoration ecology projects.
